page.title: 17CARE VILLAGE
page.content: Care Village is a home for handicapped people run by the Care Organisation. The house was built in 1834 and called the Philippines after Philip Earl Stanhope. The people who live there all have their own room and during the day they work at different activities. The women do sewing and make all different kinds of toys, cushions and patchwork garments. The men do woodwork making small items of furniture and some make bowls on the lathe. The house has large gardens where all kinds of plants are grown to sell and the grounds are looked after by the villagers. The people who live there are very well looked after and very happy.
